title: 107_s1129
content:
There is no text provided in the prev_chunk, so I will summarize the curr_chunk directly:

"PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH." "PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH. Executive Schedule Pay Rates amended to adjust annual pay rates for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia based on comparability payments." The annual rate of pay for positions at each level of the Executive Schedule in the District of Columbia will be adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The annual rate of pay for positions in the Executive Schedule in the District of Columbia will be adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. Adjustments under this subsection will be made before adjustments under subsection (a). The adjusted annual rate of pay will be treated as the official rate for the positions involved. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions in DC will be adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees. The adjusted rate will be treated as the official rate for the positions. No adjustment will continue after the comparability payment has ended. Amendments are made to Section 5372a of title 5, US Code for contract appeals board members. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions in DC will be adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees. Amendments are made to Section 5372a of title 5, US Code for contract appeals board members to ensure no less than 97 percent and 94 percent of the rate under paragraph (1) is maintained. Amendments are made to Section 5372a of title 5, US Code for contract appeals board members to ensure no less than 94 percent of the rate under paragraph (1) is maintained. Adjustments to the rates of basic pay for board members will be effective at the beginning of the first applicable pay period commencing on or after the first day of the month in which an adjustment takes effect under section 5303 in the rates of basic pay under the General Schedule. Each rate of basic pay for contract appeals board members shall be adjusted by an amount determined by the President to be appropriate, effective at the beginning of the first applicable pay period commencing on or after the adjustment under section 5303 in the rates of basic pay under the General Schedule. Amendments were made to exclude executive provisions and adjust rates of basic pay for contract appeals board members. Amendments were made to exclude executive provisions and adjust rates of basic pay for contract appeals board members by striking subsection (a) and inserting paragraph (1). Sections 5303(f), 5304(h)(1)(F), 5306(e), and 5373(a) of title 5, United States Code, are amended by excluding any adjustment under section 5318(b) after "Executive Schedule". Section 5307(a) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include a limitation on certain payments for employees receiving basic pay. Amendments were made to exclude executive provisions and adjust rates of basic pay for contract appeals board members. Section 5307(a) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include a limitation on certain payments for employees receiving basic pay under specific sections. Amendments were made to adjust rates of basic pay for contract appeals board members and exclude executive provisions. Regulations may extend the application to other categories of employees. References to level IV of the executive schedule are amended to level III in various sections of title 5, United States Code. SEC. 2. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE JUDICIAL BRANCH. Increase in Maximum Rates of Basic Pay Allowable for positions covered by section 604(a)(5) of title 28, United States Code, and for circuit executives under section 332(f)(1) of title 28, United States Code. The amendment increases the pay rates for circuit executives and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts. The Office of the United States Courts Personnel Act of 1990 is amended to change the levels of certain positions from level V to level IV and from level IV to level III. Additionally, provisions related to certain additional positions are also amended to reflect the changes in the Executive Schedule levels. Section 603 of title 28, United States Code, is amended to change the Executive Schedule levels for certain positions. The Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts will now be at level III instead of level IV. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date.
